author: 小浪财讯
title: 2000增强ETF（159555）跌1.41%，半日成交额415.41万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，2000增强ETF（159555）跌1.41%，报1.256元，成交额415.41万元。2000增强ETF（159555）重仓股方面， 软控股份 截止午盘跌2.04%， 众信旅游 跌1.18%， 吴通控股 跌2.97%， 格灵深瞳 跌0.42%， 天马科技 跌2.26%， 瑞鹄模具 涨3.87%， 达华智能 跌1.01%， 正业科技 跌0.96%， 信捷电气 涨1.24%， 万里石 跌3.60%。
2000增强ETF（159555）业绩比较基准为中证2000指数收益率，管理人为银华基金管理股份有限公司，基金经理为张凯、张亦驰，成立（2023-12-01）以来回报为27.38%，近一个月回报为3.32%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。

author: @3BMeteo
title: Cronaca meteo - Anomala inondazione invernale di Budapest dalle acque del Danubio. Foto e video « 3B Meteo
text: Cronaca meteo - Anomala inondazione invernale di Budapest dalle acque del Danubio. Foto e video Troppa pioggia e clima eccessivamente mite che ha sciolto la neve caduta in precedenza. ore 13:56 [di Carlo Migliore](/community/utente/carlom-12223) 1 minuto, 5 secondi A detta degli abitati della capitale Ungherese l'ultima volta che il livello del Danubio è salito di 6 metri in un mese è stato nel dicembre del 1987, ben 36 anni fa ma allora l'acqua non aveva allagato le strade di Budapest. Questo significa che l'evento iniziato due giorni fa può essere considerato un evento eccezionale. Secondo gli scienziati che si stanno occupando dell'anomalia questo è un chiaro segnale di quanto il cambiamento climatico stia influenzando l'andamento della stagione invernale nel Paese. Le esondazioni non sono inconsuete ma non accadono mai nel periodo invernale, solitamente ciò avviene nella stagione primaverile quando la neve accumulata durante l'inverno fonde e l'acqua di fusione va ad aggiungersi a quella di abbondante precipitazione ingrossando l'alveo. Se ciò capita a dicembre quando la superficie del fiume dovrebbe addirittura essere ghiacciata c'è evidentemente qualcosa che non va. Al di la delle cause questa inondazione precoce ha creato non pochi problemi in città tanto che le autorità ungheresi hanno dichiarato lo stato di emergenza. La situazione è particolarmente critica vicino al Parlamento, dove il fiume ha rotto gli argini, allagando la banchina inferiore e le strade che normalmente sarebbero trafficate dalle auto. Qui alcune foto e video dai Social. The— Liz Heflin (@liz_heflin) [#Danube]in [#Budapest] [#Hungary]today. author: Bill Berkowitz Community
title: Rob Reiner's God & Country Doc Exposes Toxic Political Power of Christian Nationalism
text: God & Country is a new documentary produced by Rob Reiner and his wife Michele. The film examines the rise of Christian nationalism; the way activists use the Bible to justify their political positions, and its growing political influence. Reiner, best known for his acting role in the 1970s sitcom “All in the Family” and for directing a series of beloved comedies, including This is Spinal Tap, The Princess Bride and When Harry Met Sally, told the Jewish Telegraphic Agency that “For decades, I was aware of… what we call now Christian nationalism. It’s a political movement, really, certainly not a spiritual or religious movement, and it started gaining more and more strength.” For decades Religious Right leaders/Christian nationalists have been stigmatizing and attacking opponents, raising large amounts of money, building huge flocks based on faith, fear and anger, launching multi-million-dollar media empires, and becoming the face of conservative evangelical Christianity. While a series of sexual and financial scandals have thinned their ranks, for many among them, the only thing they haven’t gotten away with is murder! However, the January 6 invasion of the Capitol, and their touting of Donald Trump’s big lie that the election was a fraud, shined a blazing spotlight on Christian Nationalism. David French called January 6th, the day “a violent Christian insurrection invaded and occupied the Capitol.” The attack “occurred days after the so-called Jericho March, an event explicitly filled with Christian-nationalist rhetoric so unhinged that French, Senior editor of The Dispatch, a columnist for Time, and the author of the book Divided We Fall, “warned that it embodied ‘a form of fanaticism that can lead to deadly violence.’” It was not surprising that so many In Christian nationalists took part in the January 6 Insurrection. After all, in Christian nationalist circles, Donald Trump is often referred to as the “anointed one.” In February 2022, a report titled “Christian Nationalism And The January 6, 2021 Insurrection,” was issued by a joint project from Baptist Joint Committee for Religious Liberty (BJC) and the Freedom From Religion Foundation (FFRF) (https://bjconline.org/jan6report/). Andrew Whitehead and Samuel Perry, authors of Taking America Back for God: Christian Nationalism in the United States, are among the contributors to the report. They wrote: “Survey after survey finds that close to half of Americans are at the very least supportive of the fusion of Christianity with American civic life. These Americans believe that Christianity should influence our public policies, sacred symbols, and national identity.” In reviewing God & Country -- whose official trailer can be seen at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cTQKmR6a9fw -- which recently opened in select theaters around the country, The Progressive magazine’s Annie Laurie Gaylor wrote: God & Country opens with footage showing the horrors of the January 6 insurrection complete with crosses, Jesus placards, and prayers on the Senate floor. Almost as chilling is seeing an American flag flying side-by-side with a Christian flag. Director Dan Partland does an excellent job homing in on the Christian nationalist ranting of current and historic televangelists: from Jerry Falwell to today’s Greg Locke, and political leaders such as Ralph Reed, Tony Perkins, and Michael Flynn. The film is based on Katherine Stewart book The Power of Worshippers: Inside the Dangerous Rise of Religious Nationalism. She pointed out that “In a country where 40 to 50 percent of the people don’t vote, you don't need a majority to dominate an election cycle. All you need is a disproportionately activated and motivated and organized minority.” Among those interviewed are North Carolina-based activist Bishop William Barber, New York Times columnist David French, Christianity Today editor-in-chief Russell Moore, Sister Simone Campbell and Phil Vischer, the co-creator of the Christian cartoon series “VeggieTales.” Research and background material for the film was provided by Right Wing Watch, a project of People For the American Way, the organization founded by the late Norman Lear, the creator of “All in The Family,” and a number of other popular television series. Right Wing Watch’s Kyle Mantyla recently noted that “The roster of right-wing figures featured in the film reads like a who’s who of Right Wing Watch posts over the years; the film’s credits include thanks to Right Wing Watch for providing source material. In anticipation of the film’s release, we have put together his a quick overview of just who these activists are to help viewers understand their views and roles within the larger Christian nationalist movement” (https://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/whos-who-in-god-country/). Rob Reiner told the Jewish Telegraphic Agency (https://www.jta.org/2024/02/16/united-states/in-new-documentary-god-and-country-rob-reiner-shines-a-light-on-christian-nationalism) that making God & Country was a difficult project to navigate because it is “a very delicate subject to take on, because the one thing we didn’t want to do was bash Christianity, and the film does not do that. ‘It’s the exact opposite, actually.” He added: “They believe that America should be a white Christian nation, and it is ordained by God to be a white Christian nation,” said Reiner, adding that its followers are “willing to go to the lengths of violence to get their way.” “The ideology of Christian nationalism, which has become deeply entrenched in American society over centuries, will take generations to dismantle,” said Amanda Tyler, executive director of Baptist Joint Committee and organizer of the Christians Against Christian Nationalism initiative “Christianity does not and cannot unite Americans under a national identity. As we learn more about Christian nationalism, how it debases Christianity, and how it threatens to destroy American democracy, we are even more convinced of the need for a national commitment – from religious and secular groups and individuals – to furthering the American ideal that our belonging in society is not in any way conditioned on or connected to our religious identity.”

author: BOSS Editorial
title: How NovoPath’s LIS is Transforming Pathology Labs
text:
Software is reshaping pathology labs, driving greater efficiency, accuracy, and improved patient outcomes. At the forefront of this transformation is NovoPath’s [Laboratory Information System](https://www.novopath.com/) (LIS), a powerful software solution that offers an all-in-one platform for managing lab operations. This article will explore how NovoPath’s LIS significantly impacts pathology labs by streamlining workflows, enhancing data accuracy, and supporting better patient care.
What is NovoPath’s LIS?
NovoPath’s[ laboratory information system](https://www.novopath.com/resources/blog/how-does-a-laboratory-information-system-help-your-lab/) is a comprehensive software solution designed specifically to manage pathology labs’ diverse and complex needs. It provides end-to-end automation, covering everything from sample tracking and test management to generating reports and handling billing. Built with pathologists and lab staff in mind, NovoPath’s LIS enables seamless workflows, making lab operations faster, more efficient, and highly accurate.
As a specialized system, NovoPath’s LIS is tailored to handle the unique challenges of pathology labs. It simplifies processes and centralizes data, allowing lab professionals to focus on what matters most—delivering timely and accurate diagnostic results to healthcare providers and patients.
How NovoPath’s LIS is Transforming Pathology Labs
Pathology labs have long relied on manual processes, often leading to delays, data handling errors, and administrative headaches. NovoPath’s LIS is changing this narrative by digitizing lab operations and offering features that make workflows more efficient, data more accessible, and compliance more manageable to make straightforward.
By adopting NovoPath’s LIS, labs can more effectively manage high volumes of samples and data, supporting faster diagnostics and better patient care.
The Key Benefits of NovoPath’s LIS for Pathology Labs
1. Streamlined Workflows
NovoPath’s LIS brings order to lab operations by automating many routine tasks that can slow down productivity. NovoPath’s LIS ensures that every process step is efficient and organized, from tracking samples with barcodes to generating alerts when results are ready.
This automation frees lab staff to concentrate on core tasks like analyzing samples and interpreting results. The result is faster turnaround times, which is crucial in delivering timely patient care.
2. Increased Accuracy & Enhanced Patient Safety
Accuracy is critical in pathology; even minor mistakes can have serious consequences. NovoPath’s LIS minimizes these risks by digitizing data entry and validation. It replaces manual record-keeping with automated processes that accurately match and track the correct patient details, test requisitions, and samples.
NovoPath’s LIS significantly reduces errors due to mislabeling or manual data entry. This means patients receive safer, more reliable results, and lab professionals can trust the integrity of their data.
3. Seamless System Integration
NovoPath’s LIS is designed to integrate smoothly with other healthcare systems, such as Electronic Health Records (EHR) and Hospital Information Systems (HIS). This integration eliminates data silos, enabling faster communication and collaboration with other healthcare departments.
For lab professionals, this seamless integration ensures more accurate billing, quicker sharing of results, and better overall efficiency. Healthcare providers also benefit, as they can access patient lab results promptly, supporting better-informed decision-making.
4. Easy Compliance & Regulatory Adherence
Keeping up with compliance is a demanding aspect of running a pathology lab, but NovoPath’s LIS simplifies it. The software can automatically generate necessary reports, track audits, and maintain documentation that meets the standards set by organizations like the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) and the College of American Pathologists (CAP).
These compliance features help labs stay within regulatory requirements and reduce the risk of penalties due to non-compliance. NovoPath’s LIS updates labs with the latest regulations, making compliance more manageable.
5. Advanced Security & Data Privacy
NovoPath prioritizes patient data protection. Its LIS software includes advanced security measures like encryption, role-based access controls, and secure data storage. These measures ensure that sensitive patient information is protected, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and maintaining compliance with data privacy laws, such as HIPAA.
With NovoPath’s LIS, labs can assure patients that their data is handled securely and responsibly, building trust and confidence in lab services.
6. Real-Time Insights for Better Decision-Making
NovoPath’s LIS goes beyond essential disaster management by offering real-time analytics that provide actionable insights. Labs generate massive volumes of data daily. NovoPath’s analytics tools help labs track performance metrics, identify workflow inefficiencies, and anticipate demand for certain test specific real-time visibility. This allows lab managers to make informed decisions that improve efficiency, optimize resources, and enhance overall operations. For healthcare providers, it means quicker access to reliable results, improving diagnosis speed and accuracy.
7. Adaptable & Scalable Solution
NovoPath’s LIS is built to grow with your lab. Whether a lab is adding new services, expanding locations, or integrating additional departments, NovoPath’s LIS offers the flexibility to scale operations without major disruption.
This adaptability is essential in the fast-evolving healthcare industry, where labs must keep up with emerging diseases, new diagnostic methods, and changing patient demands. NovoPath’s LIS supports labs in staying agile and efficient while maintaining high-quality results.
Why Choose NovoPath’s LIS?
If you’re considering LIS software for your pathology lab, NovoPath offers an intuitive, customizable solution that aligns with your lab’s needs. Here’s why NovoPath stands out:
- Automation: It handles end-to-end lab automation, reducing manual work and errors.
- Integration: It seamlessly connects with EHR, HIS, and other healthcare systems.
- Compliance: It includes built-in tools for easier adherence to regulatory standards.
- User-Friendly Design: It features an interface that’s easy to navigate for lab staff at all skill levels.
- Data Security: It prioritizes patient data protection and protects information from breaches.
NovoPath’s LIS is designed to help labs operate more efficiently, improve diagnostic accuracy, and ultimately enhance patient outcomes.
Shaping the Future of Pathology Labs with NovoPath
Software continues to shape the future of pathology labs, and NovoPath is at the forefront of this transformation. With its innovative LIS, NovoPath is helping labs move beyond manual processes and embrace a more advanced, patient-centered approach to healthcare.
By choosing NovoPath’s LIS, labs can enhance productivity, improve data accuracy, and streamline operations, paving the way for better patient outcomes and a more robust, productive lab environment. Learn more and schedule a demo at novopath.com.

author: Ramit Chauhan
title: 'Don't forget, what we did in Australia and England': Rohit Sharma after India's dismal performance in first Test vs South Africa | Cricket News - News9live
text: New Delhi: The first Test against South Africa was one to forget for India after suffering a defeat by an innings and 32 runs at the SuperSport Park in Centurion. The miserable outing in Centurion also meant that India's hopes of winning a Test series in the rainbow nation for the first time were dished. Looking at India's past record in the red-ball format, it was rare that the Men in Blue suffered an innings defeat. Indian skipper Rohit Sharma stressed on the fact that the side cannot be written off after the thrashing against the Proteas as they have beaten top-notch teams like Australia Down Under and drew a series against England in the last three years. "Yes, we had a performance like this here. But, don't forget, what we did in Australia and England. In Australia, we won the series, there our batters stepped up. In England, we drew a series, we shone with both bat and ball," said the Indian captain during the post-match press conference. Indian skipper fails to fire Rohit, who is known for his batting prowess, was unable to go big at Centurion. In the first innings, the 36-year-old was the first to depart after scoring just five runs in 14 balls. Riding on KL Rahul's gritty knock, India went on to post a total of 245 in their first innings. After South Africa made 408 and established a lead of 163 runs, the second innings became crucial for the Indian batters who could not afford to fail. But Rohit, yet again, became the first to be sent back to the pavilion after being castled by South African speedster Kagiso Rabada for a duck. Apart from Virat Kohli (76), the Indian batters failed to make a mark and crumbled for 131 in their second essay. India's second and final Test against South Africa will be held at Newlands, Cape Town starting from January 3.

title: LP hails Supreme Court judgment on LG autonomy
text: The Labour Party leadership has welcomed Thursday’s judgment of the Supreme Court affirming fiscal autonomy on local government administration in Nigeria.

author: CCMA
title: Telenotícies - Telenotícies vespre - 28/12/2023 - 3Cat
text: Subtítols en: català Mil dies sense pluges abundants: Catalunya s'encamina cap a l'emergència per sequera i amb rècord de temperatures els dotze mesos del 2023. El govern espanyol eliminarà gradualment les rebaixes de l'IVA de la llum i el gas, però mantindrà l'impost a la banca. El govern espanyol redibuixa les mesures per frenar la inflació: mantindrà l'impost a la banca i a les energètiques i restablirà progressivament l'IVA de la llum i el del gas. Pere Aragonès demana responsabilitat als partits per aprovar els nous pressupostos. La Renovació del Consell General del Poder Judicial serà la gran batalla dels pròxims dies entre el PP i el PSOE. Netanyahu vol incrementar els atacs a Gaza, on els bombardejos s'han intensificat la nit de Nadal. La nit de Nadal deixa almenys un centenar de morts a la Franja de Gaza pels bombardejos d'Israel. Aquestes festes els preus de la gasolina i el gasoil arriben als mínims de l'any. Omplir el dipòsit de benzina serà fins a un 13% més barat que al setembre. Més de 150 soldats israelians han mort a Gaza des de l'ofensiva terrestre del 27 d'octubre, dels quals 15 en les últimes 48 hores. Israel intensifica els atacs per tenir el control total del nord de la Franja de Gaza. Els preus alts marquen les compres d'última hora i afavoreixen les vendes de productes de segona mà per als regals de Nadal. Sánchez i Feijóo pacten que la Comissió Europea faci de mediadora en les negociacions per renovar el Poder Judicial. Alberto Núñez Feijóo demana a Pedro Sánchez que la Comissió Europea faci de mediadora en les negociacions per la renovació del Consell General del Poder Judicial. Pere Aragonès i Pedro Sánchez comencen a complir alguns dels compromisos d'investidura: pacten una llei de plurilingüisme i la reactivació de la taula de diàleg. Pere Aragonès i Pedro Sánchez tanquen 5 grans acords, entre els quals hi ha els traspassos de Rodalies i de la gestió de l'ingrés mínim vital. Emissió del "Telenotícies vespre" - 20/12/2023 Els 27 països de la UE aproven una llei d'immigració comuna que comportarà reforçar els controls d'entrada i endurir les condicions d'asil. Emissió del "Telenotícies vespre" - 19/12/2023 El president del govern espanyol, Pedro Sánchez, confirma, però sense data, que es reunirà amb Carles Puigdemont i amb Oriol Junqueras, per separat. Controvertida visita d'un grup d'eurodiputats a Catalunya per analitzar la immersió lingüística a les escoles.
